articles.title: British people are now more negative about Brexit than ever before

articles.author: Daniel Brown
articles.title: A Russian journalist who was reported assassinated just showed up at news conference and announced he faked his own death
articles.description: A Russian journalist and fierce critic of Vladimir Putin who was thought to be assassinated on Tuesday in Ukraine showed alive up at a news conference on Wednesday, according to several reports.

articles.author: David Choi
articles.title: North Korea could reportedly open a burger joint as a show of goodwill to Trump
articles.description: A South Korean special adviser previously said Kim Jong Un wanted to modernize his economy with iconic brands, such as a McDonald's and a Trump Tower.

articles.author: Adam Payne
articles.title: George Soros' campaign to publish plan for stopping Brexit on anniversary of May's election disaster
articles.description: Best For Britain — the anti-Brexit group funded by investor George Soros — will publish a 'roadmap' to a second Brexit referendum on Friday, June 8.

articles.author: Alexandra Ma
articles.title: Police are responding to a helicopter crash near a military base in northern England
articles.description: A helicopter crashed into a crop field in Aldborough, a few miles away from a British army airfield. The North Yorkshire fire service reported receiving a call at 1:26 p.m.

articles.author: Charlie Floyd
articles.title: This is how craft beer is brewed at Beavertown — one of the UK's biggest craft breweries
articles.description: This liquid is filtered using a whirlpool and the used barley is taken away and used for animal feed. Once filtered yeast is added to the mixture and it is left to ferment. The fermentation process takes three or four days. Once fermented more hops are added, this process is called dry hopping.

articles.author: Will Martin
articles.title: Italy just raised $6.5 billion selling debt — but the prices show just how little faith markets have in the country
articles.description: Italy auctioned a total of €5.6 billion...

articles.author: Alex Lockie
articles.title: Kim Jong Un reportedly cried over North Korea's bad economy, and it could show he's ready to cave to Trump
articles.description: A video of North Korean leader Kim Jong Un crying about his country's terrible economy while surveying its coast has reportedly made the rounds in the country's leadership — and it could be a sign he's ready to cave in to President Donald Trump in negotiations.

articles.author: Alan Dawson
articles.title: The entire Saudi Arabian refereeing team has been banned from the World Cup over a match fixing scandal
articles.description: FIFA, the world governing body for football and the organisers of the World Cup, has dropped the Saudi Arabian refereeing team from the 2018 competition as one official has been caught up in a match fixing scandal in his home country.

articles.title: Evan Spiegel said it was 'frustrating' Snap hired scantily clad women dressed as deer for a party
